page.title: 06Kingswood Golf Club
page.content: Kingswood Golf Course was built in 1928 by Sir Richard Costain to provide {sporting amenities}for the Kingswood Warren Estate.The course is of full championship length (6821 yards) and is one of the best in the South East of England.The course itself is dotted with picturesque clumps of fir trees and commands a delightful{landscape across the Chipstead Valley of Reigate Hill. The club's{recreation facilities comprimise a bar, a ladies' lounge, bridge room and four fine squash courts.There is also a new dining room where meals are served seven days a week. The club has its own resident professional. In 1982 Kingswood Golf Club was chosen as the venue for the Golf Writer's Association of England and Scotland International Match.
